newsitem.title: USA: Ladbroke made overtures to ITT - SEC filing.
newsitem.headline: Ladbroke made overtures to ITT - SEC filing.

text.p: Ladbroke Group Plc Chief Executive Peter George held talks in February 1996 with ITT Corp officials about a possible joint venture or merger, according to documents filed with the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission on Friday.
The filing, made by Hilton Hotels Corp to formalize its $6.5 billion hostile bid for ITT, said no combination resulted from the talks. Further details were unavailable.
Ladbroke owns Hilton International Inc, which operates Hilton hotels overseas. Ladbroke and Hilton Hotels have entered into an alliance to market the Hilton brand name.
George is a member of Hilton Hotels's board, and Hilton Hotels Chief Executive Officer Stephen Bollenbach sits on Ladbroke's board.
The documents also disclosed that Arthur Goldberg, former chairman of Bally Entertainment Corp, had contacted ITT about a possible merger in late 1992 and in 1996.
The talks did not result in any combination, and Hilton Hotels and Bally went on to merge in 1996. Goldberg is now the president of Hilton's gaming operations.
